__e: -Can a man be so involved in the story that it is dependent on him will not change?
I just said, it is not an absence of a man what I have is from God.
But I can't help but notice the absence of one of you.
But you must be as frightened as I am of death... and godlessness.
Courage is not the absence of fear but rather the judgment that something else is more important than fear.
I'm only familiar with the gardens at home and at the clinic.
Good a place as any for you to be... in the sheriff's absence.
Does this have anything to do with your father's absence?
Thank you. I feel him weighing on me more in his absence, than I did when he was around.
I usually head out to our beach house Friday morning to beat the weekend rush, so it won't be a surprise that I'm gone.
It seems that my army was afraid during my absence, is not it?
My being away hasn't anything to do with it.
Yeah. I wonder if it had something to do with the absence of pain.
Speaking of "control," there's seems to be some question as to who exactly is in charge with you being out of town.
Peace is not the absence of war, but a new found love for one another.
And what does the captain expect me to do in his absence?
It was my father's, and I find, even in his absence, I am much more comfortable in my old room.
I come in with a note from Daddy, that I'm being appointed the Hand of the King in his absence.
I know that my absence is difficult for you.
But the biggest problem caused by your absence is that you're not there when the people you protect need you the most.
It's like you say, sir... unless my presence here... is doing my patient more harm than my absence would, it's my duty to stay.
